intro: Onosma elegantissima, commonly known as the Persian shield, is a flowering plant native to the mountains of Iran. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety foliage with deep green and purple hues. The plant produces small, tubular flowers in shades of blue and purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated for its unique appearance and resilience in dry conditions.
